title: Call Imp
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| [![Call imp.png](/images/4/47/Call_imp.png)](/File:Call_imp.png) Call Imp |                                                                                                                   |
| :------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Level                                                                     | 2                                                                                                                 |
| School1                                                                   | [Summoning](/Summonings "Summonings")                                                                             |
| Source(s)                                                                 | [Book of Blood](/Book_of_Blood "Book of Blood") [Book of Minor Magic](/Book_of_Minor_Magic "Book of Minor Magic") |
| [Casting noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                               | 2                                                                                                                 |
| [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                 | 0                                                                                                                 |
| Power Cap                                                                 | 100                                                                                                               |
| Flags                                                                     | Selfench, Unholy                                                                                                  |

|   |                                                                                                                                 |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Calls forth a minor demon from the pits of Hell. The demon will fight alongside the caster for a time depending on spell power. |

**Call Imp** is a level 2 [Summoning](/Summonings "Summonings") spell which summons a cerulean imp.

[Hedge Wizards](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard") and [Summoners](/Summoner "Summoner") start with this spell in their spell library.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Monster Version](#Monster_Version)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Summons a single [cerulean imp](/Cerulean_imp "Cerulean imp"). It will be holding a [spear](/Spear "Spear"), with an [enchantment](/Enchant "Enchant") of `pow/10 - 4` (rounded down).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The spear will never be [branded](/Brand "Brand").

Higher spell power increases the spear enchantment. It does not increase the summon's [HD](/HD "HD").

Duration of the summon is around 27 turns; it does not depend on spell power.

There is a summon cap of 1 imp; casting the spell again will cause the old summon to very quickly time out.

## Strategy

Imps are cheap to create, and they can help deal with many early game fights. Thanks to their [polearm](/Polearm "Polearm"), cerulean imps can attack from behind their caster (or other summons). This makes imps useful, even if you have otherwise stronger summons like [Call Canine Familiar](/Call_Canine_Familiar "Call Canine Familiar").

## Monster Version

The monster version works similarly to the player version, though Natasha can summon up to 3 imps at once.

The following enemies cast Call Imp:

- h [![Natasha.png](/images/c/c3/Natasha.png)](/File:Natasha.png) **[Natasha](/Natasha "Natasha")**

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), the summon [duration class](/Duration_class "Duration class") ranged from 2 (around 18 turns) to 6 (around 171 turns). The formula was `2 + 1d(pow)/5` duration class (capped at 6).
- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), this spell would summon a [crimson imp](/Crimson_imp "Crimson imp"), [white imp](/White_imp "White imp"), [iron imp](/Iron_imp "Iron imp"), or [shadow imp](/Shadow_imp "Shadow imp"). It also had a power cap of 100.
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), this spell had a summon cap of 3.
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), the type of an imp varied with spellpower. Higher spell power increased the probability of getting a shadow or iron imp and decreased the chance of summoning a crimson imp.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), summoned [shadow imps](/Shadow_imp "Shadow imp") could give you permanent undead allies by casting [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead"), allowing characters without [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") to create undead armies.
- Prior to [0.7](/0.7 "0.7"), Call Imp was a level 3 spell. Also, it could not summon iron imps.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [spl-summoning.cc:916](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/spl-summoning.cc#L916) (0.30.0)
html:
Call Imp

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
 Call Imp
Level 2
School1 Summoning
Source(s) Book of Blood
Book of Minor Magic
Casting noise 2
Spell noise 0
Power Cap 100
Flags Selfench, Unholy
Calls forth a minor demon from the pits of Hell. The demon will fight alongside the caster for a time depending on spell power.

Call Imp is a level 2 Summoning spell which summons a cerulean imp.

Hedge Wizards and Summoners start with this spell in their spell library.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Monster Version
  • 4 History
  • 5 References

Useful Info

Summons a single cerulean imp. It will be holding a spear, with an enchantment of pow/10 - 4 (rounded down).[1] The spear will never be branded.

Higher spell power increases the spear enchantment. It does not increase the summon's HD.

Duration of the summon is around 27 turns; it does not depend on spell power.

There is a summon cap of 1 imp; casting the spell again will cause the old summon to very quickly time out.

Strategy

Imps are cheap to create, and they can help deal with many early game fights. Thanks to their polearm, cerulean imps can attack from behind their caster (or other summons). This makes imps useful, even if you have otherwise stronger summons like Call Canine Familiar.

Monster Version

The monster version works similarly to the player version, though Natasha can summon up to 3 imps at once.

The following enemies cast Call Imp:

  • h Natasha

History

  • Prior to 0.31, the summon duration class ranged from 2 (around 18 turns) to 6 (around 171 turns). The formula was 2 + 1d(pow)/5 duration class (capped at 6).
  • Prior to 0.30, this spell would summon a crimson imp, white imp, iron imp, or shadow imp. It also had a power cap of 100.
  • Prior to 0.28, this spell had a summon cap of 3.
  • Prior to 0.25, the type of an imp varied with spellpower. Higher spell power increased the probability of getting a shadow or iron imp and decreased the chance of summoning a crimson imp.
  • Prior to 0.12, summoned shadow imps could give you permanent undead allies by casting Animate Dead, allowing characters without Necromancy to create undead armies.
  • Prior to 0.7, Call Imp was a level 3 spell. Also, it could not summon iron imps.

References

  1. ↑ spl-summoning.cc:916 (0.30.0)

Higher spell power increases the spear enchantment. It does not increase the summon's [[HD]]. Duration of the summon is around 27 turns; it does not depend on spell power. There is a summon cap of 1 imp; casting the spell again will cause the old summon to very quickly time out. ==Strategy== Imps are cheap to create, and they can help deal with many early game fights. Thanks to their [[polearm]], cerulean imps can attack from behind their caster (or other summons). This makes imps useful, even if you have otherwise stronger summons like [[Call Canine Familiar]]. ==Monster Version== The monster version works similarly to the player version, though Natasha can summon up to 3 imps at once. {{monsters with spell}} ==History== *Prior to [[0.31]], the summon [[duration class]] ranged from 2 (around 18 turns) to 6 (around 171 turns). The formula was 2 + 1d(pow)/5 duration class (capped at 6). *Prior to [[0.30]], this spell would summon a [[crimson imp]], [[white imp]], [[iron imp]], or [[shadow imp]]. It also had a power cap of 100. *Prior to [[0.28]], this spell had a summon cap of 3. *Prior to [[0.25]], the type of an imp varied with spellpower. Higher spell power increased the probability of getting a shadow or iron imp and decreased the chance of summoning a crimson imp. *Prior to [[0.12]], summoned [[shadow imp]]s could give you permanent undead allies by casting [[Animate Dead]], allowing characters without [[Necromancy]] to create undead armies. *Prior to [[0.7]], Call Imp was a level 3 spell. Also, it could not summon iron imps. ==References==
